sentences: VMware Identity Manager 3.3.3<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 21.08.0.1<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 21.08.0.0<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 20.10.0.1<crlf>VMware Identity Manager (vIDM)<crlf>VMware vRealize Automation (vRA)<crlf>VMware Cloud Foundation<crlf>vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager

VMware Identity Manager 3.3.3<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 21.08.0.1<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 21.08.0.0<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 20.10.0.1<crlf>VMware Identity Manager (vIDM)<crlf>VMware vRealize Automation (vRA)<crlf>VMware Cloud Foundation<crlf>vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager

VMware Identity Manager 3.3.3<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 21.08.0.1<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 21.08.0.0<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 20.10.0.1<crlf>VMware Identity Manager (vIDM)<crlf>VMware vRealize Automation (vRA)<crlf>VMware Cloud Foundation<crlf>vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager

Run View-Active-Admin-users.sql to see all administrators (readonly administrators also included) and run View-Active-Local-users.sql to see all local users who will be disabled. Make sure that View-Active-Admin-users.sql shows at least 1 provisioned (usually from a Directory) administrator<crlf>Run Disable_All_Local_users.sql to disable all local users and administrators<crlf>Run View-Active-Admin-users.sql to see which administrators now remain active. Only provisioned (usually Directory users) userType administrators should show here.<crlf>Login to Workspace ONE Access/VMware Identity Manager appliance using a sshclient as root user. Restart the service using the command service horizon-workspace restart. Repeat this process for all appliances in your environment.<crlf>Until the hotfixes are applied, do not create any new local users.

Run Reenable_Disabled_Users.sql to enable the previously disabled users<crlf>Run View-Active-Admin-users.sql and View-Active-Local-users.sql to confirm that local users and administrators have been re-enabled

Repeat this process for all appliances in your environment.<crlf>Until the hotfixes are applied, do not create any new local users.

Restart the service using the command service horizon-workspace restart. Repeat this process for all appliances in your environment.<crlf>Until the hotfixes are applied, do not create any new local users.

titles: Rewterz Threat Advisory VMware VMSA-2022-0014 Actively Exploited

sentences: VMware Identity Manager 3.3.3<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 21.08.0.1<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 21.08.0.0<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 20.10.0.1<crlf>VMware Identity Manager (vIDM)<crlf>VMware vRealize Automation (vRA)<crlf>VMware Cloud Foundation<crlf>vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager

VMware Workspace ONE Access, VMware Identity Manager, and VMware vRealize Automation could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions. By sending a specially-crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain administrative access.

VMware Workspace ONE Access, VMware Identity Manager, and VMware vRealize Automation could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions. By sending a specially-crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain administrative access.

sentences: VMware Identity Manager 3.3.3<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 21.08.0.1<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 21.08.0.0<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 20.10.0.1<crlf>VMware Identity Manager (vIDM)<crlf>VMware vRealize Automation (vRA)<crlf>VMware Cloud Foundation<crlf>vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager

VMware Workspace ONE Access, VMware Identity Manager, and VMware vRealize Automation could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions. By sending a specially-crafted request, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain administrative access.

VMware Identity Manager 3.3.3<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 21.08.0.1<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 21.08.0.0<crlf>VMware Workspace ONE Access 20.10.0.1<crlf>VMware Identity Manager (vIDM)<crlf>VMware vRealize Automation (vRA)<crlf>VMware Cloud Foundation<crlf>vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager

Run View-Active-Admin-users.sql to see all administrators (readonly administrators also included) and run View-Active-Local-users.sql to see all local users who will be disabled. Make sure that View-Active-Admin-users.sql shows at least 1 provisioned (usually from a Directory) administrator<crlf>Run Disable_All_Local_users.sql to disable all local users and administrators<crlf>Run View-Active-Admin-users.sql to see which administrators now remain active. Only provisioned (usually Directory users) userType administrators should show here.<crlf>Login to Workspace ONE Access/VMware Identity Manager appliance using a sshclient as root user. Restart the service using the command service horizon-workspace restart. Repeat this process for all appliances in your environment.<crlf>Until the hotfixes are applied, do not create any new local users.
